title: Asia's rich drive a $200-billion revival in complex equity notes
description: Wealthy Asian investors are pouring record funds into complex stock products. Issuance of these products linked to Hong Kong and Singapore equities has surged significantly this year. Accumulators and fixed-coupon notes are particularly popular. This trend coincides with a surge in Asian equities driven by artificial intelligence. These instruments offer controlled stock exposure, though complexity can amplify losses.
content:

title: Our Brains Can Still Outsmart AI Using One Clever Trick
description: Despite the rapid advances in artificial intelligence in recent years, the humble human brain still has the edge over computers in its ability to transfer skills and learn across tasks.
content:
Despite the rapid advances in artificial intelligence in recent years, the humble human brain still has the edge over computers in its ability to transfer skills and learn across tasks. A new study reveals how we likely do this.

title: Indian envoy Kwatra discusses AI, defence, trade with US lawmakers
description: WASHINGTON, Dec 14 : India’s Ambassador to the US Vinay Mohan Kwatra has held meetings with senior Democratic lawmakers, discussing cooperation in emerging technologies, defence, and trade as part of efforts to further strengthen bilateral ties. In a social media post on Saturday, Kwatra said he held an “engaging conversation” with Congressman Ted Lieu, Vice Chair of the House Democrats Caucus, during which they discussed shared priorities on emerging developments in artificial intelligence, defence and security cooperation, trade and investment, […]
content:

title: Israel joins 'Pax Silica' international AI initiative
description: Israel has joined the Pax Silica initiative, a strategic move led by the United States that was unveiled during an international conference attended by nine leading countries in the fields of artificial intelligence, semiconductors and advanced industries.
